page.title: 03Glenury Distillery
page.content: A typical Scottish industry in the survey area is{Glenury Distillery} which makes malt whisky. In May 1985 production was stopped because of a recession in the whisky industry although it could be ro_opened in a few years time if the recession improves. The distillery was first started in 1824 by a Captain Barclay of Ury to provide a market for barley in an agricultural depression. It was bought by Distillers Company Limited in 1953 and is operated by the subsidiary company Scottish Malt Distillers (SMD). Glenury stands on a site of about 1 hectare with 5.5 hectares of farm land owned by SMD and let to tenants. At the beginning of 1985 there was a total workforce of 17.
